text: Hi everyone! Hope you all had a restful weekend. Just a friendly reminder to complete the Doodle poll for the end of semester social by the end of the day today. THanks! <https://doodle.com/poll/ub9tgq2rxydm5yx3?utm_source=poll&utm_medium=link>

attachments.title: Doodle: OSSSG End of Semester Social
attachments.text: Doodle is the simplest way to schedule meetings with clients, colleagues, or friends. Find the best time for one-to-ones and team meetings with our user-friendly calendar tool. Get started today!
attachments.fallback: Doodle: OSSSG End of Semester Social

elements.text: Hi everyone! Hope you all had a restful weekend. Just a friendly reminder to complete the Doodle poll for the end of semester social by the end of the day today. THanks!

text:
Hi again everyone!

We have already come to the end of the inaugural semester of the OSSSG! Thank you for your support of this initiative.

The organizing committee will be thinking carefully of how to build on the success of this first semester going forward. To do this, we are hoping to get your feedback on how things went this semester, and whether you have ideas for the future of this group. Please consider filling out this short anonymous feedback survey to let us know your thoughts. You are also welcome to add a comment to this post or  slack DM/email anyone on the feedback committee (Gwen, Jenelle, Jassleen or myself).

<https://survey.ucalgary.ca/jfe/form/SV_8H6HYwAMyInihs9>

attachments.title: Online Survey Software | Qualtrics Survey Solutions
attachments.text: The most powerful, simple and trusted way to gather experience data. Start your journey to experience management and try a free account today.
attachments.fallback: Online Survey Software | Qualtrics Survey Solutions

elements.text:
Hi again everyone!

We have already come to the end of the inaugural semester of the OSSSG! Thank you for your support of this initiative.

The organizing committee will be thinking carefully of how to build on the success of this first semester going forward. To do this, we are hoping to get your feedback on how things went this semester, and whether you have ideas for the future of this group. Please consider filling out this short anonymous feedback survey to let us know your thoughts. You are also welcome to add a comment to this post or  slack DM/email anyone on the feedback committee (Gwen, Jenelle, Jassleen or myself).
